author: Corky Emrick
title: Mendon beats Athens
text: Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 11:14 PM Mendon’s volleyball team picked up a non conference win over Athens 25-13, 25-9, 25-19 Thursday night. Cassie Plummer had 32 assists, one block and one kill, Megann Leighton added 20 kills and one block and Brandy DeLeeuw had eight kills and one block. Amaijha Bailey had nine digs and five aces, Nancy Steinacker had five aces, Kaley Smith dominated play in the back row with 20 digs and near perfect in serve/receive. She also had four aces. Emma Eberstein added 11 digs and had four kills. Dowagiac 25, 25, 25 Sturgis 19, 21, 19 Sturgis was swept by Dowagiac 25-19, 25-21, 25-19 in Wolverine Conference play Thursday. Hannah Bronstetter had four kills, four blocks and three digs, Nikki Nelson had three blocks and two kills, Paige Robinson added three blocks and 10 kills. Morgan Pueschel had 13 digs, Harmony Groves had eight digs and one assist, Camryn Hamlin had three digs and two kills and Rachel Huff had four digs. Cloie LaRoy added five digs, Brianna Wheeler had 19 assists six digs and two kills, Paige Andrews added one assist and one kill and Lexi Mazzoni had two digs. Bronson 25, 25, 25 The Lady Vikings swept league foe Cassopolis 25-18, 25-22, 25-14 Thursday night. With the win, Bronson is a perfect 5-0 and are league champions. “This was a goal of this team (league champs),” coach Jean LaClair said. “Now we need to start to fucas on the next phase of the season...the state tournament. We certainly have some areas we need to improve upon and some things that we need to fix.” Jill Pyles had 15 kills, three digs, two aces and one block, Alexa Ratkowski had 23 assists, five digs, six aces and three kills and Kirin Cekander added 13 kills, seven digs, one block and one assist. Kiera Lasky had 17 digs, Adyson Lasky added eight digs, Allie Sikorski had 11 digs, five kills and one aces and Ashton Wronikowski had three kills and one block. Clare Mayes had two kills, Jenna Smoker added two kills and Kiana Mayer recorded two kills, two blocks, two assists and two digs. Burr Oak 25, 25, 25 Litchfield 10, 18, 8 Burr Oak made quick work of SCAA rival Litchfield 25-10, 25-18, 25-8. Abby Greene had nine aces, three digs and one kill, Chelsey Boyd added seven aces, six kills and eight digs, Hannah Root had one kills and one dig and Ivy Eels recorded three kills. Kaitlin Cooper had five kills and four digs, Lexi Habib had two aces, four kills and three digs and Megan Schipper had one ace. Page 2 of 2 - Sydney Owens had 16 assists and one ace and Zoe Lewis had one ace, one assist and one dig. South Haven 25, 21, 25, 25 Three Rivers 20, 25, 20, 22 Service errors came back to haunt Three Rivers in a 25-20, 21-25, 25-20, 25-22 loss to South Haven. The loss dropped the Lady Cats Conference record to 3-3. Megan Southland had 16 kills, Shelby Krawczak had nine kills, Tessa Hawkins added 31 digs, Abby Springer led with three blocks and Maya Bidelman had a team high 34 assists.
